Detailed Description

Exception class.

Author:
Lee Netherton
The Exception class is used to throw exceptions which will halt the simulation. For example: 
        // Check for range error
        if(value<min_range || value>max_range)
                        throw Exception();
By default Exception class is equiped with a string member variable equal to "General Exception". This string will be printed when the simulaton halts. To provive a more discriptive exception, the exeption class can be inherited from and then thrown: 
        class RangeException : Exception
        {
                // Constructor
                RangeException();
        };
        RangeException::RangeException() : m_exception_name("General Exception") {}
   
        ...
   
        // Check for range error
        if(value<min_range || value>max_range)
                throw RangeException();
